concept.title: Creating Accounts and Contacts
concept.abstract: Accounts are organizations and companies that need to be tracked within the organization. In a non-profit environment, accounts are created for companies, groups, and organizations, although partners and governing bodies also qualify as accounts. Contacts are individuals related to an account.

conbody.p: Each account stores information associated with it such as a name, address, and phone number. Accounts may have related contacts, memberships, orders, and cases which can be accessed from the related lists below the account record.

p.b: An account can have several related contacts, however, each contact can have only one related account.
